page.title: 10Public Buildings in Westhill
page.content: Westhill is a{community}of 8,500 people but has very few public buildings given the size of the population.There are only 11 public buildings.They are the two churches, Westhill Academy,Westhill and Crombie Primary Schools,and community centre, library,play school,public conveniencies,scout hut and Ashdale Hall. The Ashdale Hall is used for many community functions including dancing,coffee mornings and public meetings to discuss matters of importance to local residents. The library is the most popular because people don't have to travel 12 kilometres to Aberdeen and because the library has a wide variety of books and records. Kirkton of Skene Church is our Parish Church;Trinity Church was built in 83.
